Package ca.openosp.openo.managers

Class RxManagerImpl

java.lang.Object
ca.openosp.openo.managers.RxManagerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
RxManager
@Service public class RxManagerImpl extends Object implements RxManager
Manager class to access data regarding prescriptions.

  • Method Details

    • getDrugs

      public List<Drug> getDrugs(LoggedInInfo info, int demographicNo, String status) throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Gets drugs for the given demographic that are marked as current.
      Specified by:
      getDrugs in interface RxManager
      Parameters:
      info - details regarding the current user
      demographicNo - the demographic to get current drugs for.
      status - the status to filter on the meds, one of {ALL, CURRENT, ARCHIVED}
      status - the status to filter on the meds, one of {ALL, CURRENT, ARCHIVED}
      Returns:
      a list of the drugs that are marked as current in the demographics record.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - when a status that is not supported is requested.

    • getCurrentSingleLineMedications

      public List<String> getCurrentSingleLineMedications(LoggedInInfo loggedInInfo, int demographicNo)
      Get a list of formatted medications the demographic has prescribed and are active. The returned list contains the drug's special field, or if one doesn't exist, the medication's name.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentSingleLineMedications in interface RxManager
      Parameters:
      loggedInInfo - Current user's logged in info
      demographicNo - The demographic number to get the medications for
      Returns:
      List of medication information from the medication's special field

      Returns:
      the drug object that was added.

    • updateDrug

      public Drug updateDrug(LoggedInInfo info, Drug d)
      Updates the a drug, d, that is passed in the database. The update is completed by making a "new" entry for the updated version of the drug and then setting the "old" version to archived. This is done so that: a) audit trail is maintained; b) database state will remain workable for legacy versions.
      Specified by:
      updateDrug in interface RxManager
      Parameters:
      info - information regarding the user making the request.
      d - the drug to replace the old version with.
      Returns:
      a drug object representing the new version, null otherwise.

    • discontinue

      public boolean discontinue(LoggedInInfo info, int drugId, int demographicId, String reason)
      Updates a drug entry in the database to be "discontinued", this entails: a) marking the entry as archived; b) setting a reason for archiving; c) setting the archive date.
      Specified by:
      discontinue in interface RxManager
      Parameters:
      info - information for the logged in user
      drugId - the id of the drug to discontinue
      demographicId - the demographic for the drug to discontinue
      reason - a word/phrase that describes why the drug is being discontinued, one of: {"adverseReaction","allergy","discontinuedByAnotherPhysician", "increasedRiskBenefitRatio", "newScientificEvidence", "noLongerNecessary" "ineffectiveTreatment", "other", "cost", "drugInteraction", "patientRequest", "unknown", "deleted", "simplifyingTreatment"}
      Returns:
      true if the drug was successfully discontinued, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the reason for discontinuing the drug is not recognized.

    • prescribe

      public RxManager.PrescriptionDrugs prescribe(LoggedInInfo info, List<Drug> drugs, Integer demoNo)
      Creates one new prescription which references all of the listed drugs. Requires the user have write privileges. Marks old drugs as archived ("represcribed") and creates new versions of the listed drugs to associate with the prescription.
      Specified by:
      prescribe in interface RxManager
      Parameters:
      info - the current user's logged in information.
      drugs - a non-empty list of the drugs to prescribe
      demoNo - the demographic to prescribe for.
      Returns:
      a record of the prescription and drugs, null if the prescription could not be created.

    • getHistory

      public List<Drug> getHistory(Integer id, LoggedInInfo info, Integer demographicNo)
      Finds the history of a drug using its ATC code.
      Specified by:
      getHistory in interface RxManager
      Parameters:
      id - the drug id to find the history of
      info - the current users info
      demographicNo - the identifier for the demographic.
      Returns:
      a list of previously documented drugs that make up the history, empty list if no history could be found.

    • canPrescribe

      protected Boolean canPrescribe(Drug d)
      Determines if all of the information to create a valid prescription is present in the drug object. Only check the bare minimum fields.
      Parameters:
      d - the drug to check.
      Returns:
      true if the drug contains the required fields, false otherwise.

    • readCheck

      protected void readCheck(LoggedInInfo info, int demographicNo)
      Access control check: determines current user is allow to READ prescription information for the current demographic.
      Parameters:
      info - information regarding the user making the request.
      demographicNo - the identifier for the patient being accessed.
      Throws:
      AccessDeniedException - if access is denied.

    • writeCheck

      protected void writeCheck(LoggedInInfo info, int demographicNo)
      Access control check: Determines if the current user is allowed to WRITE prescription information to the chart of the current demographic.
      Parameters:
      info - information regarding the user making the request.
      demographicNo - the identifier for the patient being accessed.
      Throws:
      AccessDeniedException - if access is denied.

      Specified by:

    • archiveDrug

      public boolean archiveDrug(LoggedInInfo info, int drugId, int demographicId, String reason)
      Description copied from interface: RxManager
      Archives a drug. This will remove the drug from the current list. The drug can still be found under the 'All' section.
      Specified by:
      archiveDrug in interface RxManager
      Parameters:
      info - Logged-in user information.
      drugId - The ID of the drug to archive.
      demographicId - The demographic ID.
      reason - The reason for archiving the drug.
      Returns:
      True if the drug was successfully archived, false otherwise.
